Zainab Alasadi

UX Designer & Developer

hello@zainabalasadi.com

About me:

I’m a designer and engineer living in Sydney, Australia. I rethink the status quo through experimentation, compassion and inclusivity.

Work:

Currently, I’m a CS thesis student at UNSW, exploring how scientists can automate lab tasks through human-robot interaction.

I’m also a researcher at Wriveted, helping students find books they love through a conversational interface. Before that, I was at Macquarie Bank, Oscar and 180DC.

Coming soon.

Elsewhere on the interwebs:

  1. Retweeting cool things on Twitter (say hi!)
  2. Expanding my bookshelf
  3. Transforming Australian census data into real narratives

Recent musings:

“An exclusion habit is the belief that whoever starts the game also sets the rules of the game. We think we don’t have power to change a game, so we abdicate our accountability.”
(Kat Holmes, 2018)
